title: Zendesk Needs to Find Peace in Solitude
sub_head: Acquisition of SurveyMonkey parent looks unlikely against sharp opposition
body:
Monkey business doesn’t seem to be alluring for Zendesk shareholders.
The company’s three-month campaign to sell investors on its controversial bid to acquire SurveyMonkey parent Momentive Global looks increasingly stretched. Shareholders of both companies are scheduled to vote on the matter on Feb 25. But the bid already has sparked the threat of a proxy challenge by activist Jana Partners. And on Friday, influential shareholder advisory firms ISS and Glass Lewis both came out against the move.
